actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to remove the restriction on the use of certain private institutions under the dependents' medical care program.

summary.text: Removes the restriction on the use of private non-profit institutions under the dependents' medical care program for members of the armed forces. Provides that when a member dies while he is eligible for the receipt of hostile fire payments, and it is determined that his wife is pregnant, she may be provided care for that pregnancy on the same basis prescribed for the dependents of members who are on active duty. (Amends 10 U.S.C. 1079(d); Adds 10 U.S.C. 1089)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to remove the restriction on the use of certain private institutions under the dependents' medical care program.
